alert.note: Alert for Greenlee (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 8:01PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, Greenlee. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 801 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cold Creek, Gila River, Linden Creek, Limestone Gulch, San Francisco River, Silver Basin Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Chase Creek and Eagle Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clifton, Morenci, York, Guthrie and Three Way. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
